dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, can anyone just build whatever they want in Almaty now, or is it just the US? Like, what's going on with this new consulate?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, can anyone just build whatever they want in Almaty now, or is it just the U S? Like, what's going on with this new consulate?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, okay, so, the Mazhilis deputies, they actually, um, ratified an agreement for a US consulate there, right? In Almaty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, okay, so, the Mazhilis deputies, they actually, um, ratified an agreement for a U S consulate there, right? In Almaty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Mazhilis deputies have ratified an agreement with the United States to allocate a land plot for the construction of a consulate in Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but I heard there's, like, a huge problem with where it is. And, uh, how tall it's gonna be.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, you're not wrong. There was, uh, a pretty heated debate during the bill discussion about urban planning rules.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Urban planning rules that, apparently, don't apply to everyone. This 22-meter thing? That's over the limit on Al-Farabi Avenue, isn't it? That's, like, the most expensive land.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Part of the building under construction may reach a height of 22 meters. These 22 meters could be critical: Al-Farabi Avenue has a zoning limit above which buildings cannot be constructed. This is the most expensive land in our country and the most prestigious area.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, um, Deputy Ponomarev, he totally brought that up. He specifically asked if it, uh, complies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, Deputy Ponomarev, he totally brought that up. He specifically asked if it, uh, complies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Does the construction of the U.S. Consulate fall under this restriction? Does it comply with the established urban planning regulations?" asked Mazhilis deputy Sergey Ponomarev during a plenary session.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it doesn't. He literally said theyâ€™ve demolished floors for this exact reason before. So why is this different?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it doesn't. He literally said they've demolished floors for this exact reason before. So why is this different?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There have been precedents where high floors were demolished.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, the First Deputy Minister, Rakhmetullin, he confirmed it's, uh, slightly over. But there was, like, a compromise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, the First Deputy Minister, Rakhmetullin, he confirmed it's, uh, slightly over. But there was, like, a compromise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Akan Rakhmetullin confirmed that the permitted consulate building height of 22 meters slightly exceeds the established limit. ... This was a compromise solution," explained the deputy minister.

dialogue_turns.text: A compromise? What, they just say "oops, diplomatic immunity" and suddenly the rules don't matter?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A compromise? What, they just say oops, diplomatic immunity and suddenly the rules don't matter?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, it's, um, Article 9. A small percentage, like one-point-five percent of the total land, got an exemption for, you know, ventilation shafts and communication antennas.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Article 9, about 1.5 percent of the total land area was granted an exemption from this limit to accommodate ventilation shafts and communication antennas.

dialogue_turns.text: Well, the idea, when they negotiated, was that they'd, uh, build deeper underground to compensate. That was, um, the solution.
